p: Mark Pallansch ( Figure 9) received his BS in Biochemistry (1976) from Virginia Tech and PhD in Biochemistry (1982) from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. For his postdoctoral fellowship (1984), he studied persistent measles infections at the Rockefeller University in New York. Currently, he is Director of the Division of Viral Diseases at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, in Atlanta, Georgia. The polio laboratory at CDC serves as the lead centre for the WHO Global Polio Laboratory Network supporting the Global Polio Eradication Initiative (GPEI).
